isis.stitle: 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTLO-14613 - REMOVE - LEFT REVERSE IDLER GEAR ASSEMBLY

figure.caption: Figure 59. Left Reverse Idler Gear Assembly Exploded View

step1.para: Move the mainshaft reverse gear as far to the rear as possible and remove the snap ring from the I.D. of the gear ( Figure 60).

figure.caption: Figure 60. Remove Snap Ring From I.D. of Gear

step1.para: Move the reverse gear forward and against the LO speed gear, engaging the splines of the mainshaft sliding clutch ( Figure 61).

Use inside jaw pullers or impact puller to remove the auxiliary countershaft front bearing race from the left reverse idler gear bore ( Figure 62). If necessary, repeat the procedure for removing the auxiliary countershaft front bearing race from the right reverse idler gear bore.

figure.caption: Figure 62. Remove Auxiliary Countershaft Front Bearing Race

step1.para: Loosen the nut on the idler shaft ( inset, Figure 63). Remove the stop nut and washer from the front of the idler shaft ( Figure 63).

figure.caption: Figure 63. Loosen Nut on Idler Shaft and Remove Stop Nut and Washer

step1.para: Remove the pipe plug from the rear of the idler shaft and use an impact puller, 1/2" -13 threaded end, to remove shaft from case bore ( inset, Figure 64).

figure.caption: Figure 64. Remove Pipe Plug From Rear of Idler Shaft and Remove Shaft From Case Bore

step1.para: As the idler shaft and idler plate are moved to the rear, remove the thrust washer and gear from the case ( Figure 65). If necessary, remove the inner race from the bearing and remove the needle bearing from the idler gear.

figure.caption: Figure 65. Remove Thrust Washer and Gear From Case
